description: Building on the interplay between pathophysiology, pharmacology and the nursing process in NURS
314, this course expands upon the holistic nursing care for ill patients of various ages.
Students utilize diverse roles of the nurse to manage the care of children and adults with
complex abnormalities in the clinical setting.  Offered annually in
the fall semester.  Prerequisites: open to senior nursing majors only; NURS 314 with grade of C or
above; concurrent enrollment in NURS 312 and NURS 316.
